body.name: Taken by the Beastly Highlander: A Medieval Historical Romance Novel (From Enemies to Marriage Book 2)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Leaning to Trust Again
reviews.reviewText: Wow, what a story. This is an amazing story of how people can be misjudged, and others can have two very different faces they wear. Kiera and her family were tricked by a Laird Eric into believing he wanted to marry her and take care of her. As was the custom at this time she goes to live in his Castle before the wedding. Only to find out his dark secrets quickly. He is an abuser and enjoys hitting her and causing her pain. Her life has taken a deadly turn for the worse. When the Castle is attacked, she sees her only chance to escape. Only to run Stright into Eric’s biggest enemy, the feared Laird MacPherson, Christian. After all she has been through, could fate be so cruel? Christian can’t believe that a man could hit and hurt someone so beautiful. Kiera is about to learn the truth of who to trust and those who lie and are evil through and through. This book has a lot of twists and turns with issues that may be disturbing for some. They fit the story and helps one understand what little woman had a say in back them. There is also a lot of understanding, passion, love and faith in this book. I hope you will give it a read and find out just how much two people can care for and love the other. Once you start reading you will not be able to put it down, you will cry, laugh and want to kill some too. Enjoy the ride. I received an ARC from the author and wish to thank her. This is my honest opinion and am freely giving it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better Than the First Book
reviews.reviewText: This was a much better story than the first book. The characters were developed a d felt deeper. The plot had action, twists and turns, and romance. It still had a "Fairy Tale" feel, but the writing was richer. I took a star off, due to the poor editing, typos and sentences using the wrong name or not making my sense. Poor quality control, needs to be proofed by someone who can read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finding the one for her
reviews.reviewText: This was a story of a young women that gets betrothed to a Laird that her father chose. But after meeting she soon sees that he’s abusive and mean. She’s decided to run and when his castle is under attack she escaped to the woods. But she’s gets captured by another Laird that look’s mean. But after seeing her he decides to keep her! But now he has to show that he’s not as he seems! I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars from terror to trust
reviews.reviewText: Keira was betrothed to Eric, and as was the custom, she went to live in his castle before the wedding. However, the charming man that he had presented to her family soon disappeared and a violent one took his place. Eric derived great pleasure from beating Kiera on a daily basis. When Christian’s clan attacked Eric’s castle, she attempted to escape, only to run smack into Christian. Appalled by her bruises, he swept her away from there and took her to his own castle so that she would be safe and could heal. Two weeks later, Eric arrives with an army to take her back, which ends in his humiliation. What follows is a heartfelt story wherein Christian, a laird reputed to be ruthless, does everything he can in order to help Keira heal. On one hand, this is a violent story. On the other hand it is a lovely tale of a sigh-worthy hero rescuing and wooing his lady love. The emotions run from terror to heartache, and there is even a little madness thrown in for good measure. Very few can do the fierce warrior to gentle giant as well as this author, and I loved it from beginning to end.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2023
reviews.reviewText: It was a decent read, not her best!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Rescuers , The Protector, and His Love
reviews.reviewText: Certainly not Taken by The Beast . More like Rescued by the Warrior . Protective, Patient, Compassionate, Caring, everything you would want in your Man. The true Beast was her Horrible Betrothed. Evil, Cruel, Mean,Brutal, total opposite of what a man should be.Keira Wright was the daughter of Laird O’Donelly. She and her sister Astrid were know as the most beautiful ladies in Scotland. She was betrothed to Eric Laird Gilmore. While at his Castle fisher endured punishment which was extremely cruel.Christian Larsen Laird MacPherson had an unusual life. Cast out as a child he grew up in a gang. Learning the hard life on the streets . Now Laird he was tuff but fair. Keira and Christian meet when he finds her at the Gilmore Castle and saves her from the brutal Eric. Seeing her condition he mends her back to health. There story begins here.Lydia Kendall gives us the wonderfully Compassionate Love Story. It is Breathtaking how he takes care of her. There is just something that how a Man can take care of a women like that , just makes you all goose bumpy ! Great Romantic Experience !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Christian and Keira had me glued to the pages. She is forced to marry a man she can't stand to be around so when his castle comes under attack, she takes advantage and runs away only to be captured by Christian. She is out of the frying pan and into the fire only she is drawn to Christian. Will their relationship withstand what is coming and will Christian be able to keep Keira safe from it.I am volunteering to leave a review for an ARC of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this book, it was interesting from cover to cover. It was really hard to put down. Lydia is such a good author, I can't wait to read more of her books.
Laird saves a damel in distress!! Has an alpha male feel with out being controling ...HOTTTT!! Not all about the sex act...but definitely had the allure and had great sexual chemistry..

reviews.reviewTitle: A gripping tale of love and survival.
reviews.reviewText: Christian: “She is mine! Do ye understand, Josh? And everyone else? She is mine, and she is nae going anywhere, anywhere at all. If someone even touches her or invites Eric to take her back, or behaves rudely toward her, I will deal with the matter myself. She. Is. Mine.”--"Taken by the Beastly Highlander" is a Scottish historical romance novel by Lydia Kendall. The main characters are Keira and Christian.Keira Wright, the youngest daughter of Laird O’Donelly, is known for her beauty and intellect. She is betrothed to Eric, Laird of the Gilmor clan. However, her life takes a dark turn when she arrives at Eric's castle. He subjects her to regular physical and mental abuse, keeping her locked up and isolated from her family. When Eric's castle is raided by the MacPherson clansmen, Keira seizes the opportunity to escape. Beaten and mistreated, she reaches such a low point that death in the forest or becoming a meal for wild animals seems preferable to enduring further violence from Eric. As she tries to navigate through the chaos of smoke and fire, she runs directly into Christian.Christian Larsen, Laird of the MacPherson clan, is a dangerous and feared warrior. After his mother's death, he was abandoned by his father and left on the streets of Edinburgh. In order to survive, he joined a notoriously evil gang. Despite his young age, he quickly gained respect and became the gang's leader due to his strength and hot-headed nature. Later, he challenged his father to a duel and emerged victorious, assuming the position of the clan's laird. Under his leadership, his clan became one of the most powerful and violent clans in all of Scotland.On that day, Christian and his men were carrying out a revenge raid on Gilmor Castle to teach the Gilmor clan a lesson for their previous attempted attacks. Little did he know that, along with the spoils of war, he would also bring home a bloodied and bruised woman.Keira finds herself kidnapped and carried away. If Eric, whom she initially believed to be kind and gentle, turned into an abusive and cruel monster, what will this ruthless warlord do with her?"Taken by the Beastly Highlander" is a great story, captivating and enjoyable to read. I highly recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on July 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: From beginning to end it is a light delightful read and of course the happy ever after helps.The characters and how they develop are lovely and the villain, Eric, you will love to dislike him. Very nice read.

Kiera was greatly abused at the hand of her fiance until she was rescued by Christian a fierce highland warrior. I love how patient Christian was with Kiera nursing her to health and to trust again that she could only fall in love with him. Such an enthralling story full of twist and a happy ending. I really enjoyed this book
Keira and Christians story is gripping, full of sizzle and I was highly amused by their head butting and to read how they try to fight their feelings with little success.
